newsitem.title: CHINA: China says job of HK Preparatory Committee done.
newsitem.headline: China says job of HK Preparatory Committee done.

text.p: A Beijing-selected committee that has been preparing the framework of the future Hong Kong government has basically completed its duties, a senior Chinese official for Hong Kong affairs said on Friday.
"We can say the (Preparatory Committee's) task is basically over," Chen Ziying, deputy director of the Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office under the State Council, or cabinet, told reporters.
Chen said the decision on when to disband the Preparatory Committee was up to the National People's Congress, China's parliament.
"There must be an assessment of the Prepatory Committee's work. We will make a report to the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress," Chen said.
He added that since the Preparatory Committee was set up under the authority of the Chinese parliament, the lawmaking body would decide when to dissolve the body.

The Preparatory Committee was meeting in Beijing to make recommendations on filling the seats of Hong Kong's future legislature. Hong Kong's existing directly-elected legislature will be disbanded when the territory reverts to Chinese sovereignty on July 1 after more than 150 years of British rule.
